usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: Script uses PrEntity to select GenBeam entities directly from the drawing, performs 3D model manipulations (dbSplit, addTool/Cut), and generates 3D Body objects for the connector. There is no usage of _Viewport, sd_ prefixes, or #Type E tags common in Paper Space/Shop Drawing scripts.

opmProperties.options: Dynamic (Based on beam height: B 125-220, W 90-280)

data.raw_content:
```json
{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Inserts a BMF Gerberverbinder (metal hinged connector) between timber beams, usually for rafter-to-purlin or beam-to-beam connections requiring moment transfer or specific articulation.",
    "category": "Hardware",
    "typicalUseCase": "Used in timber engineering to connect two beams end-to-end or side-by-side with a specific steel plate profile that controls rotation and load transfer."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "sType",
      "technicalDefault": "Dynamic",
      "businessMeaning": "The specific product code of the connector (e.g., 'B 125' or 'W 160'), determined primarily by the beam height.",
      "validRange": "B 125-220, W 90-280 (System specific)",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Selects the specific geometry profile (height, width, thickness, shape) from the internal lookup tables."
    },
    {
      "name": "dDia",
      "technicalDefault": "U(4)",
      "businessMeaning": "Diameter of the nails (fasteners) used to attach the connector to the wood.",
      "validRange": "3.0 - 6.0 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Updates the technical specifications in the BOM list for the nails."
    },
    {
      "name": "nNail",
      "technicalDefault": "0",
      "businessMeaning": "The total number of nails required for the connection.",
      "validRange": "0 - 100",
      "unit": "Count",
      "affectsOutput": "Directly updates the quantity in the Hardware report."
    },
    {
      "name": "nColor",
      "technicalDefault": "171",
      "businessMeaning": "Visual color of the connector in the 3D CAD model.",
      "validRange": "0 - 255 (AutoCAD Color Index)",
      "unit": "Index",
      "affectsOutput": "Changes the display color of the generated 3D Body."
    },
    {
      "name": "dLen2",
      "technicalDefault": "U(40)",
      "businessMeaning": "Length of the nails/screws.",
      "validRange": "30 - 150 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Updates the BOM specifications for the nail size."
    },
    {
      "name": "dxFlag",
      "technicalDefault": "U(200)",
      "businessMeaning": "Horizontal distance (X-offset) for the text label leader line relative to the connector insertion point.",
      "validRange": "0 - 2000 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Moves the text label horizontally in the drawing."
    },
    {
      "name": "dyFlag",
      "technicalDefault": "U(300)",
      "businessMeaning": "Vertical distance (Y-offset) for the text label leader line.",
      "validRange": "0 - 2000 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Moves the text label vertically in the drawing."
    },
    {
      "name": "sMod2",
      "technicalDefault": "Kammnagel",
      "businessMeaning": "Commercial name or type of the nail model (e.g., 'Ring Shank Nail' or 'Screw').",
      "validRange": "Text",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Updates the description in the BOM/Hardware list."
    },
    {
      "name": "sArt2",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Article number or SKU for the nails.",
      "validRange": "Text",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Used for ordering and production tracking."
    },
    {
      "name": "sMat2",
      "technicalDefault": "Stahl, verzinkt",
      "businessMeaning": "Material of the nails (e.g., Galvanized Steel, Stainless Steel).",
      "validRange": "Text",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Appears in the BOM material description."
    },
    {
      "name": "sNotes2",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Additional notes for the workshop or installer regarding the fasteners.",
      "validRange": "Text",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Appended to the metalpart notes."
    },
    {
      "name": "sSwitch",
      "technicalDefault": "No",
      "businessMeaning": "Mirrors the connector geometry 180 degrees to switch the orientation of the 'hinge' direction.",
      "validRange": "Yes/No",
      "unit": "Enum",
      "affectsOutput": "Geometrically flips the metal plate to the other side of the insertion plane."
    },
    {
      "name": "sDescription",
      "technicalDefault": "Yes",
      "businessMeaning": "Toggles the visibility of the text label displaying the connector type.",
      "validRange": "Yes/No",
      "unit": "Enum",
      "affectsOutput": "Shows or hides the text description in the model."
    },
    {
      "name": "sDimStyle",
      "technicalDefault": "_DimStyles",
      "businessMeaning": "The CAD dimension style used to format the text label (text height, arrows, etc.).",
      "validRange": "System Dimstyles",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Formatting of the visual label."
    },
    {
      "name": "sOrient",
      "technicalDefault": "Z-Axis",
      "businessMeaning": "Determines which beam dimension is used to match the connector size: Z-Axis uses height, Y-Axis uses width.",
      "validRange": "Y-Axis, Z-Axis",
      "unit": "Enum",
      "affectsOutput": "Swaps which beam dimension is checked against the lookup table to select the connector."
    },
    {
      "name": "sArt1",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Article number or SKU for the connector plate.",
      "validRange": "Text",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Production listing for the steel plate."
    },
    {
      "name": "sMat1",
      "technicalDefault": "Stahl, feuerverzinkt",
      "businessMeaning": "Material of the connector plate (e.g., Hot-dip galvanized steel).",
      "validRange": "Text",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "BOM material listing."
    },
    {
      "name": "sNotes1",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Additional notes regarding the connector plate.",
      "validRange": "Text",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Metalpart notes in BOM."
    }
  ],
  "parameterDependencies": [
    {
      "trigger": "Beam Geometry (Height/Width)",
      "effect": "Automatically filters the available options for 'sType' and sets the default connector size based on the selected beam's dimensions.",
      "cascade": [
        "sType"
      ]
    },
    {
      "trigger": "sOrient",
      "effect": "If set to 'Y-Axis', the script treats the beam's width as the critical dimension for selecting the connector size, effectively swapping the Height and Width checks.",
      "cascade": [
        "sType"
      ]
    },
    {
      "trigger": "sSwitch",
      "effect": "Mirrors the final Body geometry across the YZ-plane of the beam.",
      "cascade": [
        "Connector Geometry"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "outputEntities": [
    {
      "type": "3D Body",
      "description": "A parametric metal plate (Gerberverbinder) representing the physical connector. It consists of a main plate and tabs generated via Body primitives (bd1, bd2, bd3, etc.).",
      "appliedTo": "Insertion Point between beams"
    },
    {
      "type": "Hardware (BOM)",
      "description": "Two entries are created: one for the Connector Plate (Gerberverbinder) and one for the Nails (Kammnagel), capturing dimensions, material, and quantities.",
      "appliedTo": "Production Lists"
    },
    {
      "type": "Text Label",
      "description": "Visual annotation (Text + Leader Line) displaying the Connector Type (Typ B/W) and Size (e.g., B 125), positioned based on dxFlag and dyFlag.",
      "appliedTo": "Model Space"
    },
    {
      "type": "Beam Split",
      "description": "If only one beam is selected initially, the script splits the beam at the insertion point to simulate two beams meeting.",
      "appliedTo": "Selected Beam"
    }

workflowDiagram: Prompt user to select first beam (Required)
Prompt user to select second beam (Optional)
Determine insertion point (Calculated midpoint if 2 beams; Prompt user if 1 beam)
Check beam count: If only 1 beam, split the beam at insertion point and store relation in map
Calculate beam geometry (Height/Width) based on Orientation property
Validate beam dimensions against catalog sizes (110-280mm)
Filter and populate 'sType' dropdown with compatible connector types
Show Properties Palette / Dialog (User confirms or edits parameters)
Read user properties and execute generation
Validate beam alignment (Check if beams are codirectional)
Identify connector type index (f) based on selected 'sType'
Generate 3D Body Geometry (Branch: Typ B vs Typ W)
Apply mirroring to body for symmetric connection
Draw Text Description (Leader line based on dxFlag/dyFlag)
Generate Hardware BOM entries (Connector Plate + Nails)

conditionalBranches.condition: Number of selected beams during insertion

path1.name: Single Beam
steps: Split selected beam at insertion point
Map resulting entities as original and new

path2.name: Two Beams
steps: Calculate midpoint between beam centers as insertion point

conditionalBranches.condition: Connector Type (Typ B vs Typ W)

path1.name: Typ B (Index < 8)
steps: Construct complex geometry using 5 primitive bodies (bd1, bd2, bd3, bd4, bd5)
Perform boolean subtraction to create specific cutouts

path2.name: Typ W (Index > 7)
steps: Construct simple geometry using 2 primitive bodies (bd1, bd2)

path1.name: Z-Axis (Default)
steps: Use dH to lookup connector size

path2.name: Y-Axis
steps: Swap local Y and Z vectors
Measure beam width (originally dH) against swapped Z-vector

path2.name: Yes
steps: Mirror the final body across the insertion plane (Pt0, vX)

validationRules.errorMessage: The cross Section of the beam has not the right size
validationRules.recovery: User must select a beam with a height/width corresponding to a valid connector size (110, 125, 140, 150, 160, 175, 180, 200, 220, 240, 260, 280)
Script erases instance. User must align the two beams so their Y-axes are parallel (or anti-parallel) effectively forming a straight line connection.

postInsertionActions.effect: Changing 'sType' regenerates geometry. Changing 'sSwitch' mirrors geometry. Changing 'sDescription' toggles text visibility.
Updates dxFlag and dyFlag properties, moving the leader line and text relative to the connector.
Swaps the dimension lookup logic (Height vs Width), potentially changing the selected connector type if the new dimension doesn't match.

data.markdown:
# BMF-Gerbervervinder.mcr

## Overview
This script inserts a BMF Gerberverbinder (metal hinged connector) to join timber beams end-to-end or side-by-side. It automatically generates the 3D steel plate geometry and corresponding hardware listings based on the beam dimensions.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Script operates directly on 3D beams in the model. |
| Paper Space | No | Not designed for layout views or shop drawings. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Does not generate 2D views directly. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: At least one `GenBeam` (Timber Beam).
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 1 (If only one beam is selected, the script will automatically split it at the insertion point).
- **Required Settings**: None.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `BMF-Gerbervervinder.mcr`

### Step 2: Select Primary Beam
```
Command Line: select one beam
Action: Click on the first timber beam you wish to connect.
```

### Step 3: Select Secondary Beam (Optional)
```
Command Line: select additional beam (optional)
Action: Click a second beam if connecting two existing beams. 
Alternatively, press Enter to skip if you are splitting a single beam.
```

### Step 4: Define Insertion Point
```
Command Line: Select insertion point
Action: If you skipped Step 3, click on the single beam where you want the split and connector to occur. 
If two beams were selected, this step is skipped automatically (insertion point is calculated).
```

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Connector | dropdown | Dynamic | Selects the specific connector profile (e.g., B 125, W 160). Options are filtered by beam height. |
| Orientation | dropdown | Z-Axis | Determines which beam dimension drives the connector size. "Z-Axis" uses Height; "Y-Axis" uses Width. |
| Switch Connector | dropdown | No | Mirrors the connector geometry 180 degrees. Set to "Yes" to flip the plate orientation. |
| Show description | dropdown | Yes | Toggles the visibility of the text label (Type and Size) in the model. |
| Dimstyle | dropdown | _DimStyles | Selects the dimension style for the text label. |
| Nail Diameter | number | 4 | Diameter of the nails/fasteners used. |
| Number of nails | number | 0 | Total quantity of nails required for the connection. |
| Nail Length | number | 40 | Length of the nails/fasteners. |
| Color | number | 171 | Visual color index of the connector in the CAD model. |
| X-flag | number | 200 | Horizontal offset distance for the text label leader line. |
| Y-flag | number | 300 | Vertical offset distance for the text label leader line. |
| Nail Model | text | Kammnagel | Commercial name/type of the nail model. |
| Article (Nail) | text | | Article number or SKU for the nails. |
| Material (Nail) | text | Stahl, verzinkt | Material specification for the nails. |
| Metalpart Notes (Nail) | text | | Additional notes for the fasteners. |
| Article (Plate) | text | | Article number or SKU for the connector plate. |
| Material (Plate) | text | Stahl, feuerverzinkt | Material specification for the connector plate. |
| Metalpart Notes (Plate) | text | | Additional notes for the connector plate. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Recalculate | Updates the connector geometry if beam properties change. |
| Erase | Removes the connector instance. |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: None used.
- **Location**: N/A
- **Purpose**: N/A (All dimensions are calculated internally).

## Tips
- **Splitting Beams**: If you only select one beam, the script automatically splits it into two separate beams at the clicked insertion point and applies the connector.
- **Alignment**: Ensure that when connecting two beams, they are aligned (codirectional) along their length; otherwise, the script will fail to insert.
- **Sizing**: The connector is designed for standard beam heights/widths between 110mm and 280mm. If your beam is outside this range, the connector will not generate.
- **Text Position**: Use the `X-flag` and `Y-flag` properties to adjust the text label position if it clashes with other model elements.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why do I get the error "The cross Section of the beam has not the right size"?**
  A: The selected beam's height (or width if Orientation is set to Y-Axis) does not match the available connector sizes in the catalog (valid ranges are 110, 125, 140, 150, 160, 175, 180, 200, 220, 240, 260, 280 mm).
- **Q: How do I flip the connector to the other side of the joint?**
  A: Select the connector, open the Properties Palette, and change the "Switch Connector" property to "Yes".
- **Q: Can I use this on the wide face of a beam?**
  A: Yes. Change the "Orientation" property from "Z-Axis" to "Y-Axis". This will use the beam's width to select the appropriate connector size.
